thread.title: Christopher Walken reads 'N Sync lyrics in SuperBowl ad
thread.title_full: Christopher Walken reads 'N Sync lyrics in SuperBowl ad | Daily Mail Online

author: Justin Enriquez For Dailymail.com
title: Christopher Walken reads 'N Sync lyrics in SuperBowl ad
text:
It is the biggest game of the year.
So it comes as no wonder why a growing soft drink company got two major stars for their big game advert.
Christopher Walken and Justin Timberlake were the stars of BAI Antioxidant Infusions' Super Bowl commercial on Sunday.
Scroll down for video
Dynamic duo: Christopher Walken and Justin Timberlake were the stars of BAI Antioxidant Infusions' Super Bowl commercial on Sunday
It was in it where the 73-year-old acting legend dramatically read lyrics for Justin's old boyband 'N Sync.
The clip started off zoomed in on a dapper Walken who wore a black three-piece suit along with a silk scarf around his neck.
He said: 'I don't wanna make really wanna make it tough, I just wanna tell you that I had enough.
'It might sound crazy, but it ain't no lie, Baby, bye, bye, bye.'
Legend: The clip started off zoomed in on a dapper Walken, 73, who wore a black three-piece suit along with a silk scarf around his neck
He's a fan: He could be heard dramatically reading lyrics for 'N Sync's 2000 hit Bye Bye Bye before turning to the person sitting on the same couch
It's JT: Timberlake could be seen giving Walken a pensive look
Awkward: They stare at each other for a while
The viewer at that point obviously realizes that they are lyrics to 'N Sync's 2000 hit when Walken looks over at the person next to him.
Timberlake, 36, is shown wearing a wine red smoking jacket as he has a pensive look on his face.
They stare blankly at one another then turn to the camera as 'N Sync's hit plays to the end of the 30-second spot.
Earlier this week the singer and actor gave a sneak peek of his incredibly dapper look, in the spot for a low-calorie soft drink - on his birthday.
Handsome: They then turn toward the camera
Yum: The 'N Sync hit could be heard as it shows a bottle of BAI Antioxidant Infusion drink
The Can't Stop The Feeling shared a teaser of the Bai drinks commercial, in which he looks sartorially on point.
He is seen wearing a wine red smoking jacket, and waistcoat complete with watch-chain, as he lounges in a classically decorated drawing room.
The handsome husband of Jessica Biel captioned the Instagram clip: 'What are you doing this weekend? #SB51 @drinkbai'
Sneak peek: Earlier this week Timberlake revealed his Super Bowl commercial for this Sunday
Classic style: The 36-year-old singer and actor gave a sneak peek of his incredibly dapper look, in the spot for a low-calorie soft drink
The Rock Your Body singer sports a cravat in the neck of his white shirt, and even finishes off his look with a blue boutonnière.
His hair is slicked back into a well-groomed side-parted crop, and he sports neatly-trimmed facial hair.
Justin has appeared previously in a Super Bowl ad nine years ago, for Pepsi.
He was also performing during the 2004 half time show when the notorious 'wardrobe malfunction' incident with Janet Jackson occurred.
Handsome: The Can't Stop The Feeling shared a teaser of the Bai drinks commercial, in which he looks sartorially on point
Smoldering: The Rock Your Body singer sports a cravat in the neck of his white shirt, and even finishes off his look with a blue boutonnière
Eye-candy: He is seen wearing a wine red smoking jacket, and waistcoat complete with watch-chain, as he lounges in a classically decorated drawing room
Justin teamed up with the beverage company and apparently had a creative hand in developing the commercial.
He explained he enjoys the drink: 'I've been a fan of Bai for a long time, and when I met Ben [Weiss, Founder and CEO of Bai] and his team, it became clear that I should be involved with this brand,' Timberlake said in October when he signed on, reports AdWeek .
The father of 21-month-old Silas went on to explain: 'As a father and someone who is cautious about what my family and I consume, I love what Bai stands for. This partnership was created from a shared desire to help people put better ingredients in their bodies without sacrificing taste.'
Couple: Justin is happily married to Jessica Biel and they share son Silas
